title.narrative: DRR AND EMERGENCY IN HEALTH SYSTEM

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Health system is strengthened for DRR and emergency response

description.narrative: Refugee and migrant mothers and their young children have been provided high quality support for infant and young child feeding (IYCF) and ECD through Mother and Baby Corners and professional outreach on their route through Serbia. With a view to sustainability, these services have been handed over to national authorities. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:19/12/2019

title.narrative: No of women benefiting from IYCF-E counselling at family support hubs, child friendly spaces and mother baby-corners

No of people reached with critical WASH supplies (including hygiene items) and services (Roma)
No of healthcare facilities staff and community health workers provided with Personal Protective Equipment (PPE)

target.value: 2020:2650 (1,000 medical staff, 80 Roma Health Mediators, 1,500 staff working in centres for social work and centres for foster care and adoption, 70 staff working with refugees and migrants)

title.narrative: No of infants (under 2) accessed mother and baby care centre services, including health services and nutrition services
